byline.contributor: Maria Eugenia Diaz contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela, Jonathan Gilbert from Buenos Aires, and Wilsson Asturizaga from Cobija.

lead_paragraph: Residents of Cobija, which has prospered under ​Mr. Morales, expect his left-wing policies to continue even though he was denied the chance to seek another term.

headline.print_headline: Clinging to Leftist Policies, if Not Their Author
headline.main: Bolivian Town Drifts From President Evo Morales, Despite Promises Kept to Left

snippet: Residents of Cobija, which has prospered under ​Mr. Morales, expect his left-wing policies to continue even though he was denied the chance to seek another term.
abstract: Experts expect Latin America to maintain its leftist political trajectory, despite dwindling support for generation of leaders whose policies inaugurated it; assert politicians like Bolivian Pres Evo Morales are now being judged by the higher standards that they inspired disenfranchised citizens to adopt.
